channel.title: Project Coords [317 era]
channel.description:
I don't know where this would 'technically' go. As this is general server disc, but at the same time it's server help. What I'm doing is writing one of those public boolean isinPlace(){ things. But I want/need the communities help. Why? Well, I plan getting all the locations of buildings into this boolean, It will also be available for all users once we/I finish. If you haven't seen it before, there's a lot of places. I'm currently starting in lumby, and getting all the coords, no where else has been done. If you'd like a location post it below. I just require you to post some form of code once you get all the buildings done in said area. Here's a [b]few[/b] areas you can pick from: Zanaris Varrock Falador Catherby East/West Ardy Camelot Canifis ...and loads more. The 'layout' of the code: [code=java] public boolean inBuilding() { //Start CityNameHere if(absX >= X1 && absX <= X2 && absY >= Y1 && absY <= Y2 || //Optional comments on what the place/building is absX >= X1 && absX <= X2 && absY >= Y1 && absY <= Y2 || absX >= X2 && absX <= X2 && absY >= Y1 && absY <= Y2 ){ return true; } return false; } [/code]
Mods: Move this as per where you think it goes. I would hope it can stay here though..
[b]Finished Zones[/b] Lumbridge (I think) Draynor Draynor Manor
[b]Zones in progress[/b] Falador

i made a region system awhile back idk it probably doesn’t meet lin’s standards but its a lot better and easier than this

also, if you do end up finishing this I’ll need it a lot

Has better/easier system than this
Still needs this

What?
[/quote]

He’ll need the coordinates.

This is the topic you were talking about, Clawz:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Oh, makes a bit more sense. His wording just made it funny…

Anyways, I’m bout 60% done with draynor now. I got lazy last night.

Edit:
Reading into Clawz’s region system. I don’t think that it would suite what I’m doing. Granted it’s good. However, it’s more for getting location based off a huge rectangle/square. I’m getting lots of unknown size squares/rectangles. I’m sure there is a better way to do this, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Coords [317 era]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:4, topic:509373”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=627620.msg4265583#msg4265583 date=1364002561]

I would never, ever in a million years ever use or work on a system like this. Not only is it hard to read and edit, but it doesn’t even return which building you’re in. Sounds like a lot of work for something can be much more easily achieved using an external system.

I don’t have a clue on any other way. Plus, it’s only to check if you’re in/out of them.

[/quote]Well, what you should be doing is first defining in a class what a region consists of: a name, start, and size (or end). Then have a file that contains the properties of each region. In the class you created earlier, have a method that returns whether or not a coordinate is in the region. In your entity class, have a method that loops through all the regions and finds which one the entity is in. This way, you can check if it’s null for whether or not they’re in one or actually use the specific one.[/quote]
and I literally have no idea how to do that.
Lin, I know you’re amazing at this
If you want to help me learn the better method, that you’re talking about here, that’d be amazing.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:509373”][quote author=Lin link=topic=627620.msg4265565#msg4265565 date=1363999764]
I would never, ever in a million years ever use or work on a system like this. Not only is it hard to read and edit, but it doesn’t even return which building you’re in. Sounds like a lot of work for something can be much more easily achieved using an external system.
[/quote]
I don’t have a clue on any other way. Plus, it’s only to check if you’re in/out of them.[/quote]Well, what you should be doing is first defining in a class what a region consists of: a name, start, and size (or end). Then have a file that contains the properties of each region. In the class you created earlier, have a method that returns whether or not a coordinate is in the region. In your entity class, have a method that loops through all the regions and finds which one the entity is in. This way, you can check if it’s null for whether or not they’re in one or actually use the specific one.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Coords [317 era]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t know where this would ‘technically’ go. As this is general server disc, but at the same time it’s server help.
What I’m doing is writing one of those public boolean isinPlace(){ things. But I want/need the communities help. Why? Well, I plan getting all the locations of buildings into this boolean, It will also be available for all users once we/I finish. If you haven’t seen it before, there’s a lot of places.
I’m currently starting in lumby, and getting all the coords, no where else has been done. If you’d like a location post it below. I just require you to post some form of code once you get all the buildings done in said area.
Here’s a few areas you can pick from:
Zanaris
Varrock
Falador
Catherby
East/West Ardy
Camelot
Canifis
…and loads more.
The ‘layout’ of the code:

	public boolean inBuilding() {
		//Start CityNameHere
		if(absX >= X1 && absX <= X2 && absY >= Y1 && absY <= Y2 || //Optional comments on what the place/building is
			absX >= X1 && absX <= X2 && absY >= Y1 && absY <= Y2 ||
			absX >= X2 && absX <= X2 && absY >= Y1 && absY <= Y2
			){
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

Mods: Move this as per where you think it goes. I would hope it can stay here though…

Finished Zones
Lumbridge (I think)
Draynor
Draynor Manor

Zones in progress
Falador

Read full topic
